intro: Aphyllon cooperi subsp. palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's aphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its small, showy yellow flowers and reduced leaf structure, which is typical of the genus Aphyllon. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
